title: Space Systems and the Solar System

vocab.definition: The sun and all the objects that orbit around it
A large object that orbits the sun and has cleared its orbital path
The path an object takes as it moves around another object in space
The force that pulls objects toward each other
A rocky object that orbits the sun but is smaller than a planet
To spin on an axis (like Earth turning to make day and night)
To travel around another object (like Earth going around the sun)
An object that orbits a planet; can be natural like the Moon or artificial
An icy object that orbits the sun and can have a glowing tail
A small round object that orbits the sun but has not cleared its path

teachingNotes: Use models and diagrams to show the relative sizes and distances of planets. Discuss the role of gravity in keeping planets in orbit. Compare different types of objects in our solar system.
